org.noname.wrapper

Class Poloniex.Trade

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.noname.wrapper.Poloniex.Trade
  • Enclosing class:
    Poloniex

    public static class Poloniex.Trade
extends java.lang.Object
    Wrapper for Poloniex trading API. According to Poloniex API documentation, there is a default limit of 6 calls per second

        Parameters:

      • buy

        public void buy(java.lang.String currencyPair,
                double rate,
                double amount,
                java.lang.String options)
        Places a limit buy order in a given market. Required parameters are "currencyPair", "rate", and "amount". If successful, the method will return the order number
        Parameters:
        currencyPair - Pair of cryptocurrencies (e.g. BTC_ETH)
        rate - Rate at which to buy
        amount - Amount to buy
        options - You may optionally set this to "fillOrKill", "immediateOrCancel", "postOnly"; otherwise leave as null. A fill-or-kill order will either fill in its entirety or be completely aborted. An immediate-or-cancel order can be partially or completely filled, but any portion of the order that cannot be filled immediately will be canceled rather than left on the order book. A post-only order will only be placed if no portion of it fills immediately; this guarantees you will never pay the taker fee on any part of the order that fills

      • sell

        public void sell(java.lang.String currencyPair,
                 double rate,
                 double amount)
        Places a sell order in a given market. Required parameters are "currencyPair", "rate", and "amount"
        Parameters:
        currencyPair - Pair of cryptocurrencies (e.g. BTC_ETH)
        rate - Rate at which to sell
        amount - Amount to sell

      • cancelOrder

        public boolean cancelOrder(java.lang.String orderNumber)
        Cancels an order you have placed in a given market. Required parameter is "orderNumber"
        Parameters:
        orderNumber - Order number
        Returns:
        If successful, the method will return true

      • moveOrder

        public void moveOrder(java.lang.String orderNumber,
                      double rate,
                      java.lang.Double amount)
        Cancels an order and places a new one of the same type in a single atomic transaction, meaning either both operations will succeed or both will fail. Required parameters are "orderNumber" and "rate"; you may optionally specify "amount" if you wish to change the amount of the new order
        Parameters:
        orderNumber - Order number
        rate - Rate
        amount - Optional parameter. Default is null

      • withdraw

        public void withdraw(java.lang.String currency,
                     double amount,
                     java.lang.String address)
        Immediately places a withdrawal for a given currency, with no email confirmation. In order to use this method, the withdrawal privilege must be enabled for your API key. Required parameters are "currency", "amount", and "address"
        Parameters:
        currency - Currency to withdraw (e.g. BTC)
        amount - Amount to withdraw
        address - Address into which to withdraw

      • feeInfo

        public void feeInfo()
        If you are enrolled in the maker-taker fee schedule, returns your current trading fees and trailing 30-day volume in BTC. This information is updated once every 24 hours

      • availableAccountBalances

        public void availableAccountBalances(java.lang.String account)
        Returns your balances sorted by account. You may optionally specify the "account" parameter if you wish to fetch only the balances of one account. Please note that balances in your margin account may not be accessible if you have any open margin positions or orders
        Parameters:
        account - Optional parameter. Default is null

      • tradableBalances

        public void tradableBalances()
        Returns your current tradable balances for each currency in each market for which margin trading is enabled. Please note that these balances may vary continually with market conditions

      • transferBalance

        public void transferBalance(java.lang.String currency,
                            double amount,
                            java.lang.String fromAccount,
                            java.lang.String toAccount)
        Transfers funds from one account to another (e.g. from your exchange account to your margin account). Required parameters are "currency", "amount", "fromAccount", and "toAccount"
        Parameters:
        currency - Currency to transfer (e.g. BTC)
        amount - Amount to transfer
        fromAccount - Account from which to transfer
        toAccount - Account into which to transfer

      • marginAccountSummary

        public void marginAccountSummary()
        Returns a summary of your entire margin account. This is the same information you will find in the Margin Account section of the Margin Trading page, under the Markets list

      • marginBuy

        public void marginBuy(java.lang.String currencyPair,
                      double rate,
                      double amount,
                      java.lang.Double lendingRate)
        Places a margin buy order in a given market. Required parameters are "currencyPair", "rate", and "amount". You may optionally specify a maximum lending rate using the "lendingRate" parameter
        Parameters:
        currencyPair - Pair of cryptocurrencies (e.g. BTC_ETH)
        rate - Rate at which to buy
        amount - Amount to buy
        lendingRate - Optional parameter. Default is null

        Parameters:

        rate - Rate at which to sell
        amount - Amount to sell

      • createLoanOffer

        public void createLoanOffer(java.lang.String currency,
                            double amount,
                            double duration,
                            boolean autoRenew,
                            double lendingRate)
        Creates a loan offer for a given currency. Required parameters are "currency", "amount", "duration", "autoRenew" (0 or 1), and "lendingRate"
        Parameters:
        currency - Currency for which to create a loan offer
        amount - Amount to offer
        duration - Duration of loan
        autoRenew - Automatically renew
        lendingRate - Rate at which to lend

        Cancels a loan offer specified by the "orderNumber" POST parameter
        Parameters:
        orderNumber - Order number

        Returns your active loans for each currency

      • lendingHistory

        public void lendingHistory(long unixStartDate,
                           long unixEndDate,
                           java.lang.Integer limit)
        Returns your lending history within a time range specified by the "start" and "end" parameters as UNIX timestamps. "limit" may also be specified to limit the number of rows returned
        Parameters:
        unixStartDate - Start date in UNIX timestamp
        unixEndDate - End date in UNIX timestamp
        limit - Optional parameter. Default is null

      • autoRenew

        public boolean autoRenew(java.lang.String orderNumber)
        Toggles the autoRenew setting on an active loan, specified by the "orderNumber" parameter
        Parameters:
        orderNumber - Order number
        Returns:
        If successful, "message" will indicate the new autoRenew setting
